Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant satisfied the residency requirement for Canadian citizenship under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: The applicant was absent from Canada for significant periods due to overseas employment assignments. Despite maintaining connections, he did not meet the physical presence requirement nor demonstrate a closer connection to Canada than other countries.
Court_Ruling: Federal Court dismissed the appeal, upholding the denial of citizenship
Defendant_Behavior: Extended absences from Canada for overseas employment
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to meet 1095-day physical presence requirement and failure to centralize mode of existence in Canada
Legal_Standard: Residency requirement under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Issue: Review of Citizenship Judge's decision for errors
Evidence_Used: Records of travel, employment abroad, ties to Canada
Application_Basis: Physical presence and centrality of mode of existence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Duration and pattern of absences, nature of employment, strength of residential ties
Governing_Rule: An applicant must reside in Canada for at least 1095 days in the four years preceding application and must have centralized their mode of existence in Canada
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient proof of physical presence and lack of demonstrated primary connection to Canada
Cause_Description: Applicant’s application for Canadian citizenship was denied due to insufficient residency and failure to centralize life in Canada
Evidence_Handling: Court reviewed evidence of residency and international employment through documentation and applied Koo Factors
Evidence_Issues: Weight given to applicant's maintained connections versus actual physical absence
Residency_Compliance: Not met – failed 1095-day requirement and centrality test
Evidence_Assessment: The applicant did not provide sufficient evidence to overcome the residency shortfall or prove stronger ties to Canada
Decision_Rationale: The applicant did not meet the required physical presence or demonstrate that Canada was the center of his mode of existence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of compelling evidence showing primary residence or life centered in Canada
Legal_Standard_Applied: Koo Factors for determining centrality of mode of existence
